name: Roshmalai
short_description: Nestled in Bengali tradition, this creamy dessert features soft paneer soaked in fragrant cardamom milk, delicately flavored with saffron and topped with crunchy almonds. A sweet celebration in every bite!

name: Tikka
short_description: Marinated in yogurt and a blend of spices like turmeric and cumin, this Bangladeshi tikka features tender, boneless chicken skewered and grilled to perfection, offering a burst of smoky, savory flavor.

name: Fuchka
short_description: Crispy, hollow puris filled with a tantalizing mix of spiced potatoes and chickpeas, Fuchka bursts with flavor. A beloved Bangladeshi street snack, it offers a delightful crunch and zesty freshness in every bite.

name: Keema
short_description: A beloved Bangladeshi stew, Keema features succulent ground mutton and chicken simmered with vibrant tomatoes, onions, and green peas. Spiced with fragrant garam masala, it offers a comforting, rich flavor.

name: Sandesh
short_description: Originating from Bengal, Sandesh delights with its delicate texture and sweet, milky flavor, crafted from fresh paneer, sugar, and a hint of lemon. A beloved dessert that celebrates tradition in every bite.

name: Chicken tikka (Murgh tikka)
short_description: Marinated in a vibrant blend of red chili, ginger-garlic, and spices, tender chicken pieces are grilled to smoky perfection. A beloved dish in Bangladeshi cuisine, Murgh tikka delights with its rich, savory flavors.

name: Paratha
short_description: Golden-brown and flaky, paratha hails from Bangladesh, celebrating hearty breakfasts. Each layered bite delivers a delightful crunch, often enjoyed with savory curries or tangy pickles.

name: Papad
short_description: Crispy and golden, these Bangladeshi papads are made from a blend of rice and chickpea flours, infused with cumin and asafoetida. Perfect as a snack or a crunchy accompaniment to meals.

name: Beguni
short_description: Deep-fried eggplant slices, coated in a spiced gram flour batter, create a crispy, flavorful treat in Bangladesh. Enjoy the vibrant blend of turmeric and red chili that elevates this beloved street food delight.

name: Bhorta
short_description: Originating from Bangladesh, bhortas are vibrant mashed dishes blending herbs, vegetables, or fish with zesty mustard oil. Each spoonful bursts with earthy flavors, making it a beloved staple on every table.

name: Chomchom
short_description: Originating from Bangladesh, this delightful dessert features soft, milk-based morsels cooked in sweet syrup, infused with zesty lemon and aromatic cardamom, offering a blissful taste of tradition.

name: Chotpoti
short_description: A beloved street food from Bangladesh, this vibrant dish combines chickpeas and tender potatoes in a tangy tamarind sauce, topped with onions, boiled eggs, and refreshing cucumber for a burst of flavor.

name: Ilish macher paturi
short_description: Marinated ilish fish, renowned as Bangladesh's national dish, is wrapped in banana leaves and steamed to perfection. The rich flavors of mustard, turmeric, and hot peppers create a vibrant, aromatic delight.

name: Haleem
short_description: Originating from the Middle East, this rich porridge features slow-cooked wheat and tender meat, harmonized with aromatic spices. It’s a cherished Ramadan staple, delivering warmth and comfort in every spoonful.

name: Jhalmuri
short_description: Spicy and satisfying, this Bangladeshi snack combines crunchy puffed rice with diced potatoes, onions, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Tossed together for a burst of flavor, it's a street food favorite!

name: Panta ilish
short_description: Originating from Bangladesh, panta ilish features aromatic, soaked rice paired with crispy fried ilish fish, drizzled in mustard oil and turmeric. It’s a beloved staple, especially during celebrations.

name: Panta bhat
short_description: Originating from Bangladesh, panta bhat features soaked rice, delivering a refreshing, slightly tangy flavor. Served with hot peppers and onions, it's a beloved staple that embodies local culture.

name: Jilapi
short_description: Delicately fried to perfection, these crispy coils soak in aromatic sugar syrup, creating a sweet treat that delights the senses. A beloved dessert rooted in Persian tradition, Jilapi is a must-try in Bangladesh!

name: Shami kabab
short_description: A beloved Bangladeshi delicacy, these succulent kebabs blend minced meats with split Bengal gram, infused with aromatic spices like cumin and garlic. Perfectly crisp on the outside, tender within.

name: Macher jhol
short_description: A beloved Bengali and Odia dish, this spicy fish stew features tender ilish, rohu, and catla simmered with potatoes and tomatoes in a fragrant, turmeric-infused broth. Each spoonful bursts with rich, comforting flavors.

name: Shorshe ilish
short_description: Savor the rich flavors of Bangladesh with ilish fish simmered in a luscious mustard and poppy seed sauce, spiced with hot peppers and turmeric. A beloved classic that embodies the essence of Bengali cuisine.

name: Bakarkhani
short_description: Originating from Mughlai cuisine, this flaky flatbread combines maida flour, semolina, and aromatic cardamom. Baked in a tandoor, it offers a delightful blend of buttery richness and subtle sweetness.

name: Handesh
short_description: Originating from Sylhet, Handesh delights with its chewy texture and rich sweetness from date molasses. Made with rice and wheat flour, it's a beloved treat that embodies Bangladeshi tradition.
